input: Can you get free tests if you have Medi-Cal?
gold_answer: Yes, if you have Medi-Cal, you can receive free COVID-19 tests. You can visit the MyTurn.ca.gov to find more resources for testing.

retrieved_contexts.text:
Testing Options | Sierra County, CA - Official Website
Testing Options | Sierra County, CA - Official Website

 

Skip to Main Content

 

Search

 
 
 

Your GovernmentCommunityCounty DepartmentsHow Do I

 

 

 

 

 
HomeCounty DepartmentsPublic HealthCommunicable DiseaseCoronavirus (COVID-19)Testing Options 



Testing Options 	

Residential households in the U.S. can order one set of #4 FREE at-home tests from USPS.com. Here's what you need to know about your order:Limit of one order per residential addressOne order includes #4 individual rapid antigen COVID-19 tests (COVID.gov/tests has more details about at-home tests, including extended shelf life and updated expiration dates)Have Medi-Cal? Follow these steps to receive free tests.

 
 

MyTurn.ca.gov to find testing
 
 
 
 
 

More resources for testing
 
 
 
 

Below are facilities offering testing in or near Sierra County. Many clinics offer Drive-Thru Testing options.Eastern Plumas Health Care (Loyalton) - (530) 993-1231Monday thru Thursday by appointmentEastern Plumas Health Care (Portola)- (530) 832-6600 Monday thru Friday by appointmentPlumas District Hospital (Quincy) - (530) 283-5640Sierra Nevada Medical Center (Grass Valley) - (530) 274-6000Tahoe Forest Hospital (Truckee) - (530) 582-3450 Western Sierra Medical Clinic (Downieville) - (530) 274-9762Find Testing Near You Search Tools in California and Nevada

 
 
 

FAQs about payment for COVID-19 testing:1. Must health plans cover COVID-19 testing? Yes. Health plans must cover COVID-19 tests that are FDA approved or authorized, or approved by the state, without prior authorization and at no cost to the enrollee. This includes follow-up (serial/sequential) tests. This requirement applies to such tests administered by a skilled nursing facility.  Biden-Harris Administration Requires Insurance Companies and Group Health Plans to Cover the Cost of At-Home COVID-19 Tests, Increasing Access to Free Tests (January 10, 2022)2.

retrieved_contexts.text:
Government Benefits
Care Management for Seniors
	

Need help with your care? Find out which care management program is right for you.

 
	Medi-Cal and other Health Services
	

Medi-Cal is a program that offers free or low-cost health coverage for children and adults with limited income and resources. If you qualify, you can enroll in Medi-Cal year-round.

 
	Medicare Counseling
	

Free information to help you choose the Medicare plan that's right for you.

 
	CalFresh/EBT Food Benefits
	

CalFresh provides monthly assistance to low- or no-income individuals and families. Benefits are loaded onto an EBT card that works like a debit card to use at stores to buy food.

Resources

Adult Protective Services
Report elder and dependant adult abuse 24/7

Veterans
Get information on benefits available to veterans and their families.

Information & Assistance
Chat online or on the phone about support to stay living at home safely and more.

Aging and Disability Resource Guide
Find local resources for seniors and people with disabilities.

Become a Caregiver
Earn money with flexible hours while providing housekeeping and basic in-home assistnace.

 

Adult and Aging Division
